Degenerus","details":"Architecture Overview ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- This contract operates as an external standalone contract (NOT delegatecall) called by the Degenerus ContractAddresses.COIN contract. It manages:   1. Daily quest rolling using VRF entropy   2. Per-player progress tracking with version-gated resets   3. Streak accounting with tier-based reward scaling Security Model ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- \u2022 All player-action handlers are ContractAddresses.COIN-gated via `onlyCoin` modifier \u2022 Quest normalization allows ContractAddresses.COIN OR game to trigger via `onlyCoinOrGame` \u2022 Game address fixed at deploy time \u2022 No external calls to untrusted contracts \u2014 only reads trusted `questGame` \u2022 No ETH handling or callbacks \u2014 reentrancy is not a concern Quest Lifecycle ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Coin calls `rollDailyQuest()` with VRF entropy at day transition 2. Two quest slots are seeded with weighted random types and difficulty flags 3. Player actions trigger handle* functions (handleMint, handleFlip, etc.) 4. Progress accumulates until target is met; completion updates streak 5. Both slots must complete for streak credit (prevents partial farming) Progress Versioning ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Each quest has a monotonic `version` field. When a quest mutates mid-day (e.g., burn quest converts to mint when burning is disabled), the version bumps and stale player progress is automatically reset via `_questSyncProgress`. Streak & Tier System ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- \u2022 Streaks increment only when BOTH slots complete on a day \u2022 Tiers (0-2) are derived from streak in spans of 10 \u2022 Higher tiers unlock higher quest targets but also better rewards \u2022 Missing a day resets streak to zero","errors":{"InvalidEntropy()":[{"details":"Thrown when entropy value is invalid (unused in current impl but reserved)."}],"InvalidQuestDay()":[{"details":"Thrown when quest day is invalid (unused in current impl but reserved)."}],"OnlyCoin()":[{"details":"Thrown when caller is not the authorized ContractAddresses.COIN contract."}],"ZeroAddress()":[{"details":"Thrown when a zero address is passed to constructor."}]},"kind":"dev","methods":{"getActiveQuests()":{"details":"Uses tier 0 (streak = 0) for baseline requirements. Frontends should use      `getPlayerQuestView` for player-specific tier-adjusted requirements. Note: Burn quests are downgraded to MINT_ETH/AFFILIATE in the returned view when the game is not in burn state, matching the UI behavior.","returns":{"quests":"Array of QuestInfo structs with type, day, difficulty, and requirements."}},"getPlayerQuestView(address)":{"details":"Handles streak decay preview: if player missed a day (gap > 1), the effective      streak shown is 0, matching what would happen on their next action. This is the recommended view function for frontends displaying quest UI.","params":{"player":"The player address to query."},"returns":{"viewData":"Comprehensive view including quests, progress, completion, and streak."}},"handleAffiliate(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"BURNIE earned from affiliate referrals (in base units).","player":"The affiliate who earned commission."}},"handleBondPurchase(address,uint256)":{"details":"Bond quests are only available during specific level windows.      Target is dynamically calculated based on current mint price.","params":{"basePerBondWei":"ETH value per bond purchased (in wei).","player":"The player who purchased bonds."}},"handleBurn(address,uint32)":{"details":"Burn quests are only available when game is in burn state (gameState == 3).      Uses the same target calculation as mint quests (small integer targets).","params":{"player":"The player who burned NFTs.","quantity":"Number of NFTs burned."}},"handleDecimator(address,uint256)":{"details":"Decimator quests have 2x the target of equivalent flip quests.","params":{"burnAmount":"Amount of BURNIE burned (in base units).","player":"The player who performed the decimator burn."}},"handleFlip(address,uint256)":{"details":"Progress tracks cumulative flip volume for the day.","params":{"flipCredit":"Amount of BURNIE staked/unstaked (in base units).","player":"The player who staked/unstaked."}},"handleMint(address,uint32,bool)":{"details":"Iterates both slots since both could theoretically match (though in practice      the rolling logic ensures only one slot has each mint type).","params":{"paidWithEth":"True if ETH was used (MINT_ETH quest), false for BURNIE (MINT_BURNIE).","player":"The player who performed the mint.","quantity":"Number of NFTs minted."}},"normalizeActiveBurnQuests()":{"details":"Called when game transitions out of burn state (e.g., extermination).      Converts any active BURN quests to MINT_ETH or AFFILIATE, bumping      version to invalidate stale player progress. Conversion Logic: - If the OTHER slot is MINT_ETH \u2192 convert to AFFILIATE - Otherwise \u2192 convert to MINT_ETH This ensures the two slots never have duplicate types."},"playerQuestStates(address)":{"params":{"player":"The player address to query."},"returns":{"completed":"Per-slot completion flags for current day.","lastCompletedDay":"Last day where both quests were completed.","progress":"Per-slot progress values (only valid if day/version match).","streak":"Current streak count."}},"rollDailyQuest(uint48,uint256)":{"details":"Entropy Usage: - Slot 0 uses `entropy` directly for type selection and targets - Slot 1 uses `(entropy >> 128) | (entropy << 128)` (swapped halves) - Difficulty flags are derived once from `entropy & 0x3FF` and shared","params":{"day":"Quest day identifier (monotonicity enforced by caller).","entropy":"VRF entropy word; second slot reuses swapped halves."},"returns":{"highDifficulty":"True if difficulty roll tokens."},"QUEST_TYPE_MINT_ETH":{"details":"Quest type: mint NFTs using ETH."},"activeQuests":{"details":"Active quests for the current day (indexed by slot 0/1)."},"questGame":{"details":"Reference to the Degenerus game contract for state queries."},"questPlayerState":{"details":"Per-player quest state including progress and streak."},"questVersionCounter":{"details":"Monotonically increasing cbafe9a58c9a8f8b7e7e1f809","dweb:/ipfs/QmQxQNPhqtRiNQQkSNC6haM1Y3prvdAK5DQrt5m7f3qApn"]}},"version":1}

getActiveQuests().details: Uses tier 0 (streak = 0) for baseline requirements. Frontends should use      `getPlayerQuestView` for player-specific tier-adjusted requirements. Note: Burn quests are downgraded to MINT_ETH/AFFILIATE in the returned view when the game is not in burn state, matching the UI behavior.

returns.quests: Array of QuestInfo structs with type, day, difficulty, and requirements.

getPlayerQuestView(address).details: Handles streak decay preview: if player missed a day (gap > 1), the effective      streak shown is 0, matching what would happen on their next action. This is the recommended view function for frontends displaying quest UI.

returns.viewData: Comprehensive view including quests, progress, completion, and streak.

params.amount: BURNIE earned from affiliate referrals (in base units).

handleBondPurchase(address,uint256).details: Bond quests are only available during specific level windows.      Target is dynamically calculated based on current mint price.

params.basePerBondWei: ETH value per bond purchased (in wei).

handleBurn(address,uint32).details: Burn quests are only available when game is in burn state (gameState == 3).      Uses the same target calculation as mint quests (small integer targets).

handleDecimator(address,uint256).details: Decimator quests have 2x the target of equivalent flip quests.

params.burnAmount: Amount of BURNIE burned (in base units).
params.player: The player who performed the decimator burn.

handleFlip(address,uint256).details: Progress tracks cumulative flip volume for the day.

params.flipCredit: Amount of BURNIE staked/unstaked (in base units).

handleMint(address,uint32,bool).details: Iterates both slots since both could theoretically match (though in practice      the rolling logic ensures only one slot has each mint type).

params.paidWithEth: True if ETH was used (MINT_ETH quest), false for BURNIE (MINT_BURNIE).
params.player: The player who performed the mint.

normalizeActiveBurnQuests().details: Called when game transitions out of burn state (e.g., extermination).      Converts any active BURN quests to MINT_ETH or AFFILIATE, bumping      version to invalidate stale player progress. Conversion Logic: - If the OTHER slot is MINT_ETH  convert to AFFILIATE - Otherwise  convert to MINT_ETH This ensures the two slots never have duplicate types.

returns.completed: Per-slot completion flags for current day.
returns.lastCompletedDay: Last day where both quests were completed.
returns.progress: Per-slot progress values (only valid if day/version match).

rollDailyQuest(uint48,uint256).details: Entropy Usage: - Slot 0 uses `entropy` directly for type selection and targets - Slot 1 uses `(entropy >> 128) | (entropy << 128)` (swapped halves) - Difficulty flags are derived once from `entropy & 0x3FF` and shared

params.day: Quest day identifier (monotonicity enforced by caller).
params.entropy: VRF entropy word; second slot reuses swapped halves.

returns.highDifficulty: True if difficulty roll exceeded threshold.
returns.questTypes: The two quest types rolled [slot0, slot1].

rollDailyQuestWithOverrides(uint48,uint2.details: Overrides are useful for ensuring specific quest types appear during testing      or when admin wants to guarantee certain quests are available.

params.forceBurn: If true, slot 1 is forced to BURN type (overrides game state check).
params.forceMintEth: If true, slot 0 is forced to MINT_ETH type.

getActiveQuests().notice: View helper for frontends; returns quest baselines at tier zero.

getPlayerQuestView(address).notice: Player-specific view of quests with tier-adjusted requirements and progress.

handleAffiliate(address,uint256).notice: Handle affiliate earnings credited in BURNIE base units (18 decimals).

handleBondPurchase(address,uint256).notice: Handle bond purchases tracked by the base-per-bond size (wei).

handleBurn(address,uint32).notice: Handle burn quest progress in whole NFTs.

handleDecimator(address,uint256).notice: Handle decimator burns counted in BURNIE base units (18 decimals).

handleFlip(address,uint256).notice: Handle flip/unstake progress credited in BURNIE base units (18 decimals).

handleMint(address,uint32,bool).notice: Handle mint progress for a player; covers both BURNIE and ETH paid mints.

normalizeActiveBurnQuests().notice: Normalize active quests when burning becomes disallowed mid-day.

playerQuestStates(address).notice: Returns raw player quest state for debugging/analytics.

rollDailyQuest(uint48,uint256).notice: Roll the daily quest set using VRF entropy.

rollDailyQuestWithOverrides(uint48,uint2.notice: Roll quests with optional overrides for testing/admin controls.
